intro: Phyteuma spicatum var. rapunculus, commonly known as the spiked phyteuma, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in rough, hairy foliage. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped, tubular flowers in shades of yellow to orange, which bloom in late summer. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, often found in grasslands and rocky areas. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and is commonly cultivated in gardens.
